title: How to Make Nigiri Sushi

steps.headline: Be absolutely sure of the quality and origin of your fish.
steps.description: If you're not able to verify that it is of high quality, don't use it raw. Instead, grill, roast, or bake the fish before slicing.

steps.headline: Cut each piece of seafood into small and thin slices.
steps.description: Avoid creating bulky or uneven cuts because the presentation of the fish is important.

steps.headline: Dip your hands in the su water and make sure to keep them wet.
steps.description: Having wet hands helps to prevent the rice from sticking to your hands as you work with it.

steps.headline: Take a small amount of sushi rice (about 3/4 the size of your palm).
steps.description: Roll and squeeze it together until it rolls into a firm "log" sized rectangle.

steps.headline: Place a dab of wasabi on one side of the fish slice and then place the fish on the rice "log", with the wasabi side on the rice.
Shape both items together.
steps.description:
Hold the tuna and rice in your left hand and use two fingers from your right hand to press the fish downwards and shape it in a rounded rectangle. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/db\/Nigirisushi7.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Nigirisushi7.png\/220px-Nigirisushi7.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":366,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"175","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-nigiri-sushi<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}You will need to rotate and flip the rice and fish slice to get the rounded shape, pressing the two fingers at the same time.

steps.headline: Repeat the process using the salmon and shrimp.
steps.description: This will complete three pairs of the nigiri sushi.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve the nigiri sushi.
steps.description:
The presentation of sushi is a little similar to the creation of a Zen garden for many sushi chefs. Adding all the right elements to make it look beautifully presented is an important part of the sushi making process. Artful arrangement and garnishing completes the nigiri sushi; some other ideas for presentation include the following suggestions: {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg/460px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b6/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg/224px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

"}Nigiri sushi with a little fish roe. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg/460px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/04/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg/224px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

Image from: Flickr
Taken by: avlxyz
License: Creative Commons

"}Nigiri sushi with greens.

steps.headline: Shape the rice into 10 small balls or clumps.
steps.description: Shape into a rectangle. Be sure to have wet fingers when working with the rice.

steps.headline: In one hand, pick up a piece of seasoned carrot slice.
steps.description: Cradle the carrot slice in a slightly bent finger to mold the shape.

steps.headline: Place the rectangular rice clump into the cradled carrot slice.
steps.description: Gently press the rice in using your middle and index fingers, keeping your thumb at the top to stop rice from oozing out at the end.

steps.headline: Turn the rice over.
steps.description: The carrot piece will be on the top now. Keep pushing this topping onto the rice, then turn the sushi 180 degrees and repeat. From the top, it should now be hard to see rice under the carrot slice.

steps.headline: Tie the scallion around the middle of each sushi like a belt.
steps.description: Garnish with the grated ginger and serve with Teriyaki sauce for dipping.

text:
Making Seafood Nigiri Sushi Be absolutely sure of the quality and origin of your fish. If you're not able to verify that it is of high quality, don't use it raw. Instead, grill, roast, or bake the fish before slicing. Cut each piece of seafood into small and thin slices. Avoid creating bulky or uneven cuts because the presentation of the fish is important. Dip your hands in the su water and make sure to keep them wet. Having wet hands helps to prevent the rice from sticking to your hands as you work with it. Take a small amount of sushi rice (about 3/4 the size of your palm). Roll and squeeze it together until it rolls into a firm "log" sized rectangle. Place a dab of wasabi on one side of the fish slice and then place the fish on the rice "log", with the wasabi side on the rice. Shape both items together. Hold the tuna and rice in your left hand and use two fingers from your right hand to press the fish downwards and shape it in a rounded rectangle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/db/Nigirisushi7.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/d/db/Nigirisushi7.png/220px-Nigirisushi7.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":366,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"175","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-nigiri-sushi

"}You will need to rotate and flip the rice and fish slice to get the rounded shape, pressing the two fingers at the same time. Repeat the process using the salmon and shrimp. This will complete three pairs of the nigiri sushi. Garnish and serve the nigiri sushi. The presentation of sushi is a little similar to the creation of a Zen garden for many sushi chefs. Adding all the right elements to make it look beautifully presented is an important part of the sushi making process. Artful arrangement and garnishing completes the nigiri sushi; some other ideas for presentation include the following suggestions: {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg/460px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b6/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg/224px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

"}Nigiri sushi with a little fish roe. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg/460px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/04/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg/224px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

Image from: Flickr
Taken by: avlxyz
License: Creative Commons

"}Nigiri sushi with greens. Making Vegetarian Nigiri Sushi Shape the rice into 10 small balls or clumps. Shape into a rectangle. Be sure to have wet fingers when working with the rice. In one hand, pick up a piece of seasoned carrot slice. Cradle the carrot slice in a slightly bent finger to mold the shape. Place the rectangular rice clump into the cradled carrot slice. Gently press the rice in using your middle and index fingers, keeping your thumb at the top to stop rice from oozing out at the end. Turn the rice over. The carrot piece will be on the top now. Keep pushing this topping onto the rice, then turn the sushi 180 degrees and repeat. From the top, it should now be hard to see rice under the carrot slice. Tie the scallion around the middle of each sushi like a belt. Garnish with the grated ginger and serve with Teriyaki sauce for dipping.
sentences: Making Seafood Nigiri Sushi Be absolutely sure of the quality and origin of your fish.
If you're not able to verify that it is of high quality, don't use it raw.
Instead, grill, roast, or bake the fish before slicing.
Cut each piece of seafood into small and thin slices.
Avoid creating bulky or uneven cuts because the presentation of the fish is important.
Dip your hands in the su water and make sure to keep them wet.
Having wet hands helps to prevent the rice from sticking to your hands as you work with it.
Take a small amount of sushi rice (about 3/4 the size of your palm).
Roll and squeeze it together until it rolls into a firm "log" sized rectangle.
Place a dab of wasabi on one side of the fish slice and then place the fish on the rice "log", with the wasabi side on the rice.
Shape both items together.
Hold the tuna and rice in your left hand and use two fingers from your right hand to press the fish downwards and shape it in a rounded rectangle.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/db\/Nigirisushi7.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Nigirisushi7.png\/220px-Nigirisushi7.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":366,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"175","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"}You will need to rotate and flip the rice and fish slice to get the rounded shape, pressing the two fingers at the same time.
Repeat the process using the salmon and shrimp.
This will complete three pairs of the nigiri sushi.
Garnish and serve the nigiri sushi.
The presentation of sushi is a little similar to the creation of a Zen garden for many sushi chefs.
Adding all the right elements to make it look beautifully presented is an important part of the sushi making process.

Artful arrangement and garnishing completes the nigiri sushi; some other ideas for presentation include the following suggestions: {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b6\/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg\/460px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/b6\/Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg\/224px-Anago---Shira-Nui-AUD5.50-each.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/04\/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg\/460px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/04\/Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg\/224px-Maguro---Shira-Nui-AUD4.50-each---photo-by-David.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":"224","bigHeight":"150","licensing":"

Taken by: avlxyz<\/a>
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Nigiri sushi with greens.
Making Vegetarian Nigiri Sushi Shape the rice into 10 small balls or clumps.
Shape into a rectangle.
Be sure to have wet fingers when working with the rice.
In one hand, pick up a piece of seasoned carrot slice.
Cradle the carrot slice in a slightly bent finger to mold the shape.
Place the rectangular rice clump into the cradled carrot slice.
Gently press the rice in using your middle and index fingers, keeping your thumb at the top to stop rice from oozing out at the end.
Turn the rice over.
The carrot piece will be on the top now.
Keep pushing this topping onto the rice, then turn the sushi 180 degrees and repeat.
From the top, it should now be hard to see rice under the carrot slice.
Tie the scallion around the middle of each sushi like a belt.
Garnish with the grated ginger and serve with Teriyaki sauce for dipping.
